Composting: If all trash cans disappeared, composting would be the best alternative to manage waste. Composting is a process of breaking down organic material into a nutrient-rich soil that can be used to grow plants. It is a sustainable way to manage waste and reduce the amount of waste that goes into landfills.

Reusing: People could reuse items instead of throwing them away. For example, plastic bags could be used to carry groceries or as a makeshift shopping bag. Glass jars could be used to store food or as a vase for flowers.

Recycling: People could recycle more. Recycling is the process of converting waste materials into new materials. It is a sustainable way to manage waste and reduce the amount of waste that goes into landfills.

Burning: People could burn their waste. Burning is a process of heating waste materials until they are reduced to ash. It is a quick and easy way to manage waste, but it is not sustainable and can contribute to air pollution.
Donating: People could donate their waste to others. For example, clothing and furniture could be donated to charity or to a local thrift store. Food could be donated to a food bank or to a shelter.
